item.title: Report E-2023070007
item.description:
Report E-2023070007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 14, 2023, ten (10) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. EWI personnel contained all damaged bottles in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crew then deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. All paint impacted materials were containerized in the previously stated waste drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023061259
item.description:
Report X-2023061259

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG ARRIVED @ NOKC 732 FROM DALL 753 WET AND DAMAGED WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE DUE TO LOOSE CAPS AND IMPROPER INNER AND OUTER PACKAGING. PKG WAS DOUBLED BOXED WHERE THE INNER BOX HAD A LQ STICKER BUT WAS PLACED INSIDE ANOTHER BOX FOR THE OUTER PACKAGING AND IT DID NOT HAVE THE PROPER LABELING, WHICH CAUSED THE PACKAGE TO BE HANDLED IMPROPERLY. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG AND CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN HAZ BAG AND HAZ TOTE.
